ElementAriaDisabled.summary: The ariaDisabled property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-disabled attribute, which indicates that the element is perceivable but disabled, so it is not editable or otherwise operable.

blockquote.para: Note: Where possible, use the input element with type="button" or the button element â€” because those elements have built in semantics and do not require ARIA attributes.

ElementAriaDisabled.value: A string with one of the following values:
